result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:19 PM Defendant Michael Robert Hauger not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders warrant on defendant's non-appearance. $500 Cash, reviewable by any Court Official

02:36 PM Defendant Michael Robert Hauger appeared by phone.  Prosecuting attorney Noah Tylenda by video for the State of Wisconsin. Kevin Smith appearing by video for defendant. Must sign bond by end of day September 2, 2022. Not guilty plea entered by attorney Smith. Remand to branch 2 for scheduling.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:31 AM Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Robert Hauger appeared by phone. Address and date of birth verified. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond set of $1000.00   with conditions. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Must sign bond by July 29, 2022 between 8 am and 4:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
